greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let r+i*s be the sum of the first-quadrant Gaussian primes dividing prime(n); sequence gives r values.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: s[n_] := Module[{f = FactorInteger[n, GaussianIntegers->True]}, p = f[[;;,1]]; e = f[[;;,2]]; Re[Plus @@ ((If[Abs[#]==1, 0, #]& /@ p) * e)]]; s /@ Select[ Range[100], PrimeQ] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 28 2020 *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 27 2003
